Entertainment
Emerging culture critics announced for the Herald and The Age

3 May 14:00 • 2 articles
Weight: 1.52
Importance: 1.53
Age penalty: 1.00
Best date: 3 May 14:00
Average US: 3.55
Weighted average US: 3.000883017848773
Average GB: 0.0
Weighted average GB: 0.0
Average IN: 1.9
Weighted average IN: 1.7242825657116072

Emerging culture critics announced for the Herald and The Age

The Sydney Morning Herald and The Age have selected five emerging culture critics after receiving funding from the Copyright Agency and the Judith Neilson Institute for Journalism and Ideas. The grant will enable up to 100 extra pieces of critical writing across literature, visual arts and theatre in 2020. The books critics are Bec Kavanagh and Jack Callil, who will write for both mastheads. The visual arts critics are Chloe Wolifson (Sydney) and Tiarney Miekus (Melbourne), while Cassie Tongue will cover theatre for the Herald. While the present coronavirus-induced shutdown has decimated much of the arts and culture industry and forced theatres and art galleries to close, it provides the writers with an opportunity to produce other critical pieces and highlight areas of innovation during this once-in-a-generation crisis. Kavanagh is a Melbourne-based writer who has been published in The Australian and Meanjin. "I'm looking forward to sinking my teeth into some great new stories, and writing into a space that values the contributions of writers and the arts – particularly at this time," she said. Callil is digital editor at the Australian Book Review and a proofreader at Meanjin. "Having the opportunity to write about Australia’s vibrant and diverse literary community is an exceptional privilege," he said. Wolifson has previously written for the Herald and The Guardian and has a monthly column in Art Monthly Australasia. "It's always my hope that a review I've written encourages readers to go and view the exhibition themselves and engage with the work. I'm excited for this opportunity to start more conversations about Australian contemporary art," she said. Miekus is a Melbourne-based writer and editor of Art Guide Australia. She has a strong interest in contemporary art and plays in a post-punk band. "It's both humbling and exciting to be a contributing voice on visual arts, and to have the space, time and support to think intently and purposefully on visual art," she said. Tongue has had regular theatre reviews published in Time Out and The Guardian. "I'm looking forward to writing about new Australian performance as it happens: exploring new trends, engaging deeply with what our artists have to say, and giving thoughtful responses to the work of theatre-makers and performers who might otherwise miss out on coverage," she said. Copyright Agency chief executive Adam Suckling said the five new critics will bring "important new voices to the landscape of arts criticism and review in Australia". "The current crisis has shown just how fragile and important Australian writing and visual arts practice is," Mr Suckling said. "While things are very grim for creators at the moment, the new critics will look at ways of covering Australian creativity during this terrible crisis. But they will also be in place for when, and I hope this is very soon, it is safe for Australian audiences to return to physical book launches, plays and shows at galleries." Matthew Burgess, culture editor at the Herald and The Age, said he was "thrilled" to welcome the five new critics to the mastheads after an impressive number of applications. "It is an exciting opportunity for our readers to gain fresh perspectives in visual arts, stage and books criticism," he said. "Our thanks to the Copyright Agency and the Judith Neilson Institute for supporting this important project."

3 May 14:00 • The Age • https://www.theage.com.au/culture/books/emerging-culture-critics-announced-for-the-herald-and-the-age-20200429-p54odf.html?ref=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_source=rss_feed
Rating: 2.20
Emerging culture critics announced for the Herald and The Age

The Sydney Morning Herald and The Age have selected five emerging culture critics after receiving funding from the Copyright Agency and the Judith Neilson Institute for Journalism and Ideas. The grant will enable up to 100 extra pieces of critical writing across literature, visual arts and theatre in 2020. "It is an exciting opportunity for our readers to gain fresh perspectives in visual arts, stage and books criticism," he said. Madonna attends birthday party after testing positive for coronavirus antibodies

Madonna made sure she didn't miss out on a friend's birthday party, despite recently testing positive for coronavirus antibodies. The Like A Virgin singer, 61, attended the bash in person and even hugged and presented her pal Steven Klein with a cake to mark his 55th birthday. No one at the birthday bash was wearing any protective gear like face masks, despite the worldwide coronavirus crisis. Madonna's positive test means she has recently been in contact with Covid-19. Klein's birthday party was livestreamed on the video chatting app Zoom meaning guests could attend it virtually, but defiant Madge was there in person. One of the people who attended shared a video of Madonna hugging Klein. They captioned the post: "M made an appearance at Steven Klein's Virtual Birthday Party - such a blast!! "M called his Bday cake a Covid Cake. "She's too f**king cute!!! We are living in some crazy tiMes! "But trying to make the most of it, and still have soMe fun!!! [sic]" Mirror Online has contacted Madonna's reps for comment. Madonna took to Instagram to reveal she'd tested positive for the coronavirus antibodies earlier this week. "Took a test the other day, and I found out that I have the antibodies," she said. "So tomorrow, I'm just going to go for a long drive in the car… and I'm going to breathe in the COVID-19 air. "Yep. I hope the sun is shining."

Halle Berry strips off for naked shower selfie as she takes some self care time

Halle Berry stripped naked for her latest social media offering as she posed in a nude selfie. The actress, 53, told her 6.1 million followers that she was indulging in some self-care. She added that she's been using Taraji P Henson's products, paying tribute to her pal and urging fans to give her stuff a go. "I've known this woman since she started in the industry," Halle wrote, "And it's been such a joy to watch her flourish and succeed. "Obsessed with this line, check my stories for a few of my favourites!" The Hollywood icon recently reminisced about her time in the industry, including her work on Die Another Day, Pierce Brosnan's last Bond film before he hung up the mantle. Halle recalled that the Irish actor, now 66, had to give her the Heimlich Manoeuvre as she choked on a fig during a steamy sex scene. Chatting with American talk show host Jimmy Fallon from her home, she dished: "I was supposed to be all sexy, trying to seduce him with a fig, and then I ended up choking on it and he had to get up and do the Heimlich. "James Bond knows how to Heimlich! "He was there for me, he will always be one of my favourite people in the world." She was playing love interest and fellow spy Jinx, revealing that the studio had even flirted with the idea of giving her character her own spinoff flick. She's also been battling online trolls since going into lockdown, clapping back at those who passed judgement on her for letting six year old Maceo-Robert wear high heels. "Is this your daughter or your son?" one wrote. She came back: "Well it's a he and he is having a ball. Tryna cope the best he can! Laughter helps a lot right now."

3 May 17:25 • mirror • https://www.mirror.co.uk/3am/celebrity-news/halle-berry-strips-naked-shower-21967655

Zayn Malik 'couldn't be more thrilled' Gigi Hadid is pregnant and 'always hoped' they'd reunite

Zayn Malik and Gigi Hadid are expecting their first child, they've confirmed. And the former One Direction singer, 27, "couldn't be more thrilled" with the happy news, as it's claimed he always held out hope they'd get back together. The couple have been on and off since 2015 and rekindled their relationship in December, with the news of their pregnancy coming out this week. A source told US Weekly: "Zayn has always been so into Gigi and she's always been such a big part of his life. "Even when there were times that they weren’t a couple, the love was still very much there." The couple's relationship is now "solid" ahead of the baby's arrival, it's claimed. The source added: "He was very hopeful that they would get back together." Mirror Online has contacted Zayn's reps for comment. Gigi, 25, and Zayn are currently staying at the Hadid family farm in Pennsylvania amid the coronavuris lockdown. She is said to be twenty weeks along with the pregnancy. Gigi's mum Yolanda Hadid confirmed the news after the rumours first came out. "Still shocked our little secret got leaked to the press," she told told RTL Boulevard. "Of course we are so excited. I'm excited to become a oma [grandmother] in September especially after I lost my mom so recently. Gigi then confirmed the news herself in a video chat with US talk show host Jimmy Fallon. "We're very excited and happy and grateful for everyone's well wishes and support," she gushed.

The Chase fans in disbelief over contestant's likeness to Emmerdale legend

3 May 21:30 • 2 articles
Weight: 1.48

Age penalty: 1.00

Average GB: 7.75
Weighted average GB: 12.553449930305645
Average IN: 6.75
Weighted average IN: 7.276829992356102

The Chase fans in disbelief over contestant's likeness to Emmerdale legend

Viewers tuning into The Chase's family special on Sunday, called The Family Chase, were left stunned by one contestant. Those watching the ITV gameshow dubbed her a lookalike of a former Emmerdale legend. Viewers thought contestant Paula looked so much like the character in particular, that they began calling her by said character's name. Emmerdale fans were quick to spot she looked remarkably like Val Pollard. Val was married to Eric Pollard in the Dales, before her tragic death in 2015 during the helicopter stunt. She was played by actress Charlie Hardwick since 2004. As Paula appeared on The Chase on Sunday, fans spotted the huge resemblance between her and the actress who played Val. From the hair colour to the matching style, and even the Geordie accent, fans couldn't believe their eyes. One viewer said: "Seat 2  #TheChase," with an image of Val leading to many others agreeing. Another fan agreed: "Val up now! #TheChase." A third said: "Now it's Val from Emmerdale  #Thefamilychase." Unfortunately, like her sister who went before her, Paula was caught by the Chaser, Paul Sinha, and sent home. As her departure aired, one fan tweeted: "That was too f***ing easy. Now do one back to the Woolpack, Val." A second fan hoped she might return for the final chase, and said: "Go low & bring Val back oot!" Unfortunately, it was just Hannah left to play in the final round and she and the family did not win the cash prize. The Chase airs weeknights at 5pm on ITV.

3 May 21:30 • mirror • https://www.mirror.co.uk/tv/tv-news/chase-fans-disbelief-over-contestants-21968182
Rating: 2.39
The Chase fans in disbelief over contestant's likeness to Emmerdale legend

Viewers tuning into The Chase's family special on Sunday, called The Family Chase, were left stunned by one contestant. Those watching the ITV gameshow dubbed her a lookalike of a former Emmerdale legend. Viewers thought contestant Paula looked so much like the character in particular, that they began calling her by said character's name. Emmerdale fans were quick to spot she looked remarkably like Val Pollard. Val was married to Eric Pollard in the Dales, before her tragic death in 2015 during the helicopter stunt. She was played by actress Charlie Hardwick since 2004. As Paula appeared on The Chase on Sunday, fans spotted the huge resemblance between her and the actress who played Val. From the hair colour to the matching style, and even the Geordie accent, fans couldn't believe their eyes. One viewer said: "Seat 2  #TheChase," with an image of Val leading to many others agreeing. Entertainment
Who will take Holly Willoughby's spot on Celebrity Juice?

3 May 21:41 • 2 articles
Weight: 1.48
Importance: 1.48
Age penalty: 1.00
Best date: 3 May 21:41
Average US: 16.25
Weighted average US: 18.016429974370464
Average GB: 7.75
Weighted average GB: 12.553449930305645
Average IN: 6.75
Weighted average IN: 7.276829992356102

Who will take Holly Willoughby's spot on Celebrity Juice?

Now that Holly Willoughby had opted to leave Celebrity Juice, the show needs a new team captain. With no official word on who will fill Holly's shoes, fans are busy speculating as to who will be baring the brunt of Keith Lemon's most outrageous gags. Holly did just that for 12 years, having been a team captain since the show got off the ground way back in 2008 - but who will take her place? The biggest theories are below... The Corrie and Our Girl star is probably the front runner right now. Both Michelle and hunky husband Mark Wright have made appearances on the show, and both were a hit with fans. Bookies Ladbrokes are backing her too, a spokesman saying: "Michelle Keegan's no stranger to Celebrity Juice and she could soon become a permanent fixture if the latest odds are anything to go by." She's also hung up her helmet on Our Girl, so she could have some space open in her diary... Gogglebox original Scarlett Moffatt has also been floated by fans. She's also appeared on the show, and proved a popular panellist. Ladbrokes reckon she's a solid bet, and fans know from Gogglebox she's got the comedy chops to stand her own ground. Inbetweeners star Emily went through a surge in popularity after her I'm A Celebrity stint in 2018. She's since become an ITV staple, with This Morning appearances and a hosting gig on I'm A Celebrity: Extra Camp. Emily's appeared fairly recently on Celebrity Juice, and sent Keith into overdrive by sharing a kiss with Spice Girl Mel B. Kelly and Keith must be close mates by now - she's turned up on the show, and even starred in his film, aptly named Keith Lemon: The Movie. She's already got her radio show so her diary's pretty busy, but if her recent Bake Off stint proved anything it's that she can keep fans entertained. Her rapport with pal Keith is already well established in fans' minds, so she won't take much introduction. The Italian chef is another ITV staple, and no stranger to speaking his mind. During his This Morning appearances, when he cooks with Holly and Phillip Schofield, he's become legendary for his brutal honesty and scathing criticism. He's been busy with Gordon Ramsay and Fred Sirieix on their show Gordon, Gino and Fred: Road Trip, so it's uncertain how much freedom he'll have. He'd certainly clash with Keith...

3 May 21:41 • mirror • https://www.mirror.co.uk/tv/tv-news/who-take-holly-willoughbys-spot-21968307
Rating: 2.39
Who will take Holly Willoughby's spot on Celebrity Juice?

Entertainment
Gogglebox viewers rank the stars with one group taking nearly 40% of the vote

3 May 15:05 • 2 articles
Weight: 1.48
Importance: 1.48
Age penalty: 1.00
Best date: 3 May 15:05
Average US: 16.25
Weighted average US: 18.016429974370464
Average GB: 7.75
Weighted average GB: 12.553449930305645
Average IN: 6.75
Weighted average IN: 7.276829992356102

Gogglebox viewers rank the stars with one group taking nearly 40% of the vote

Gogglebox has become beloved by millions, and everyone has their favourites. Fans recently took part in a poll that allowed them to put forward which of the 11 groups they reckoned deserved the honour of the top spot. The poll, conducted by The Liverpool Echo, asked fans to order the stars based on how much they make them laugh - with one even stealing 39% of the vote. Below are all 11 groups, ranked... London family the Vens joined the show quite late, during season 11 in 2018. Marcus, girlfriend Mica, and her two daughters Sachelle and Shuggy have become renowned for their bubbly personalities, fits of laughter, and on point honesty. Mica provided a priceless fan favourite moment as they sat down to watch Victoria Coren Mitchell's notoriously tricky Only Connect, laughing: "This show isn't for the hood, man." Dad Andrew, mum Carolyne and son Louis have been Gogglebox fixtures since the show first kicked off. Their numbers have fluctuated, as twin sisters Alex and Catheryne seem to come and go as well. The family have become best known for Andrew's uncompromising and often scathing wit, as he kicks back in that enormous armchair. Brighton hairdresser Stephen first appeared on the show alongside then boyfriend Chris, before the pair went their separate ways. He's since been joined by husband Daniel, as well as mum Pat for a stint. Stephen is responsible for one of the most iconic Gogglebox moments. As he and Chris watched the news, the latter observed: "We all like a bad boy, don't we?" A stunned Stephen looks around and answers: "Not a f**king terrorist though, Chris!" Dave and Shirley have been married for a staggering 40 years, filming the show from their home in Wales. Joining the show in 2015, fans have learned that the pair have a genuine deep love for each other - but that won't stop them having a bicker now and again. Ellie and Izzi stirred the pot recently when they made their feelings very clear about Boris Johnson. Still, the Yorkshire sisters are mostly a light hearted pair, most often obsessing over food. When they first put their names down for the show, they reckoned people wouldn't be interested in what they had to say. The poll begs to differ... Bristol besties Mary and Marina are completely unfiltered and they hold nothing back. Both in their 80s, they film from a retirement home and have won legions of fans as their conversations go off on tangents. Dad Sid and sons Baasit and Umar are well known for their no nonsense slams and quick wit. The core three are often joined by other family members, like sister Raza and their mum. The family of four have carved out a place as firm fan favourites, as have their Rottweilers. The dogs can be seen having a nose about the place and often trying to swipe a biscuit or two when they think the family won't notice. In fact, their snack collection has become the stuff of Gogglebox legend, with fans not convinced they ever eat them themselves. Probably the quirkiest couple on the list, Giles and Mary will always have a place in fans' hearts. The posh duo's home is instantly memorable, as are their lengthy and eloquent rants about whatever they're watching. Coming in second place with 23% of the vote, brother and sister Pete and Sophie were string contenders for the top spot despite only arriving on the show in 2018. The Blackpool pair have become renowned for mocking each other as much as they do the telly, so it's no surprise they've proved a hit with fans. Taking the top spot are the iconic, the legendary, the one and only Jenny and Lee. The caravan-based pair from Hull swept up a whopping 39% of the vote, landing them as the firm victors. They first met when Jenny was a landlady and Lee was a pub regular, and have since struck up the sweetest - and funniest friendship. Joining in 2014, it's not difficult to see why they've managed to place themselves at the top of the list.

3 May 15:05 • mirror • https://www.mirror.co.uk/tv/tv-news/gogglebox-viewers-rank-stars-one-21967130
Rating: 2.39

Mystery over Rob Kardashian and stunning British influencer Kenza Boutrif's new friendship

3 May 13:56 • 2 articles
Weight: 1.48
Importance: 1.48
Age penalty: 1.00

Average GB: 7.75
Weighted average GB: 12.553449930305645
Average IN: 6.75
Weighted average IN: 7.276829992356102

Mystery over Rob Kardashian and stunning British influencer Kenza Boutrif's new friendship

Rob Kardashian has just added stunning British model and influencer Kenza Boutrif to his Instagram following, taking the total up to 21. The 33-year-old reality star set tongues wagging on social media after giving the UK-based model and social media star a follow over the weekend. Rob's tiny following is usually reserved for his closest family and friends, such as his sisters Kourtney, Khloe and Kim Kardashian. The reality star's unusual move came less than a week after he made a rare appearance on Keeping Up With The Kardashians to celebrate his daughter's birthday. But what do we know about Rob's new social media friend? Kenza Boutrif is a glamorous social media model that is represented by Wilhelmina Models. She boasts an impressive following of 634,000 fans on Instagram and only follows 103 back - including Rob. The well-travelled influencer boasts pictures taken in Dubai, New York and Los Angeles among her incredible collection of jet setting snaps and she was also at London Fashion Week earlier this year. Among her stellar collection of pictures, she has also received plenty of approval from other popular UK reality stars. Some of her pictures have been liked by Love Island stars Belle Hassan and Yewande Biala. Kenza also has her own Depop page where she is selling plenty of designer goods such as Comme Des Garcons and a pair of Alexander McQueen trainers. In the meantime, Rob is currently embroiled in a bitter fued with his ex-girlfriend and model Blac Chynna. The former couple dated back in 2016 and their daughter was born just one month before their split was made official. Since then, the volatile couple have been caught up in an ongoing and complicated custody battle over their Dream. At the end of February 2020, a judge denied Rob's request to have primary custody over his daughter. Both Rob and Kenza have been contacted for comment. Do you have a story to sell ? Get in touch with us at webcelebs@trinitymirror.com or call us direct 0207 29 3303

Coronation Street’s Peter Barlow will save Yasmeen from jail and expose Geoff’s lies say fans

CORRIE fans think Peter Barlow will save Yasmeen Nazir from prison after he notices she’s been showing some worrying behaviour. It’s been a rollercoaster week on the cobbles as viewers have been left horrified by the abuse Yasmeen has experienced at the hands of her husband Geoff Metcalfe. Fans watched from behind their cushions as Yasmeen finally snapped after months of terrifying abuse and stabbed Geoff in the neck with a broken wine bottle. In spoilers for the long-running soap, it’s been revealed Yasmeen, played by Shelley King, will call the police be charged with attempted murder as street residents are left in shock at the news of the attack. But fans think Peter, played by Chris Gascoyne, will come to her rescue and tell police he’s witnessed several displays of worrying behaviour from her. One wrote: “…If you look in the last few episodes we had Sally, Eileen and Peter notice something wasn’t right but didn’t act. So maybe these are the people who will stick by Yasmeen.” And another added: “i really hope peter and eileen are going to be allies to yasmeen in the coming weeks bc they seem to be the only people to have suspicions about geoff” While a third guessed: “Calling for Peter being Yasmeen’s rescue…” Earlier in the episode fans were horrified as Yasmeen was dragged out to the pub in a red dress that charmless Geoff had originally bought for a sex worker. Geoff, played by Ian Bartholomew, took her to the Rovers to see Sally and Tim – before dropping the bombshell that he'd handed over her money to pay for their wedding. Yasmeen was shocked that he'd handed over a fortune without consulting her, but Geoff barked: "You want to do this now? Get your coat. Shift. Don't you dare turn the waterworks on in here." As she walked away from the bar the cameras lingered on Peter looking at her with concern, giving fans hope that he will realise something isn't adding up after Yasmeen's arrest Away from prying eyes at No.6 viewers watched in horror as Geoff grabbed a knife and told Yasmeen: "Maybe I should kill you – do the world a favour. Would anyone really notice if you were gone?" With that, she picked up a wine bottle and smashed abusive Geoff around the head before plunging the broken glass into his neck. Peter has been keeping an eye on Yasmeen ever since Geoff told everyone she had a drinking problem earlier this year. Fans are on the edge of their seats as they wait to see what happens, admitting they were “sucked in” by the plot. One wrote: “I love when #corrie does episodes like this. They are just so well put together and engaging. Proper sucked in by this storyline of poor Yasmeen and they're going a fantastic job of it.” Another added: “Lets go Yasmeen Thinking face Take that Geoff f**ker out preferably with a bullet bloody hard to watch #Corrie” And a third wrote: “It was very disturbing to watch but i am glad that Yasmeen has fought back. However she will not deserve to be sent to prison for this, i hope tim, sally , peter and her friends will understand what has been going on. Think Eileen does. No one shoud go through that. Awful man” We pay for videos too. Click here to upload yours.

3 May 20:20 • The Sun • https://www.thesun.co.uk/tvandshowbiz/11540145/coronation-streets-peter-barlow-save-yasmeen-jail-expose-geoff/
Rating: 2.72
Spoilers: Corrie boss reveals all on Yasmeen and Geoff ending

There have been some difficult decisions to be made throughout the long running storyline arc of Geoff Metcalfe’s (Ian Bartholomew) campaign of coercive abuse against Yasmeen Nazir (Shelley King), according to Coronation Street boss Iain Macleod – but one thing he insists is that the recent twist that saw the horrific husband left for dead was planned for the start. Viewers saw Geoff become more aggressive than ever and leave Yasmeen in terror of her life as he ranted horrific abuse and waved a knife in her face, suggesting it would be better for everyone if he just killed her. In a relexive move to defend herself, a petrified Yasmeen stabbed Geoff in the neck and will be seen phoning the police to reveal that she has killed her husband. It has been a deliberately slow paced story – and one that producer Iain admits has been the most debated over in the storyline office out of any plot. He told Radio Times: ‘It’s been refined month by month in conjunction with our charity and research partners (including Women’s Aid). We’ve known pretty much from the start this incident would be one of the major peaks. ‘It’s been organically told and we’ve agonised over the advancement of how Geoff’s behaviour evolved. ‘It has been discussed in more detail than any other story I’ve worked on, just to make sure we get the nuance right.’ The storyline has come up for almost universal praise, with many in Yasmeen’s position having commended the show for its accurate portrayal of coercive control. Iain added: ‘We don’t make it for this reason but it is important to have what I call good ‘drama karma’: what you’re putting on screen is karmically making the world little bit of a better place. I really think this story is.’ If you’ve got a soap or TV story, video or pictures get in touch by emailing us soaps@metro.co.uk – we’d love to hear from you. Join the community by leaving a comment below and stay updated on all things soaps at our homepage.

Kenya Moore Looks Gorgeous In Her White Dress For The RHOA Virtual Reunion

Rating: 0.30
Kemi Olunloyo shades Davido’s fiancee, Chioma on her birthday

Kindly Share This Story: Controversial self-styled investigative journalist, Kemi Olunloyo, joined other celebrities who took to social media to congratulate Davido’s fiancee, Chioma, as she marked her birthday Thursday. However, Kemi, in her birthday message to Chioma, couldn’t resist shading the mother-of-one as she reminded her of the Porsche car she got from Davido as her birthday gift back in 2018. Kemi Olunloyo also reminded her of the cooking show where she signed a deal for two years, and which is yet to officially kick-off. According to her, the cooking show and Porsche car are all “audio”, as they were only heard about but not seen. She wrote:  “Happy birthday Chioma. Audio cooking show nko? You announced two years ago today? 2018 Porsche nko? Have you gotten your driver’s license?” Vanguard Kindly Share This Story:

Casualty episode scrapped by BBC over Covid-19 - but fans want missing episode

Weight: 1.20

Age penalty: 1.00
Best date: 3 May 16:06

Weighted average IN: 6.753203003101645

Casualty episode scrapped by BBC over Covid-19 - but fans want missing episode

Fans of medical drama Casualty want a missing episode made available on BBC iPlayer. The episode was due to be shown this weekend but was scrapped by the BBC due to 'inappropriate' content during the current coronavirus pandemic. An announcement before last night's instalment said: "The episode we were due to watch tonight, filmed before the spread of Covid-19, was considered inappropriate to show at the moment." The episode that aired on Saturday night instead included a short catch-up that filled viewers in on scenes from the major storylines that they will have missed due to the transmission of the preceding instalment being skipped. The announcer continued before it started: "But never fear. everything we need to know from that episode is in a catch up right at the start of the programme." However, the short recap before this weekend's episode wasn't enough for some fans, who have now taken to social media calling for the BBC to make the missing instalment available on their catch-up service, BBC iPlayer. One fan wrote on Twitter : "I assumed I’d missed one so checked iPlayer but no. Turns out the BBC decided to cut it! "Please put it on iPlayer so I can decide whether to watch it!!" Another disappointed viewer commented: "Can't they just put it on iplayer then? Gives people a choice on whether they want to watch or not! #casualty " Elsewhere, a third Casualty fan commented: "That missing episode of #Casualty looks great. Bonkers decision not to show it. "I understand the reasoning but I disagree with it." Another Twitter user thought the missing episode could have helped give some viewers a realistic look at what we're all currently facing. They tweeted: "Deemed inappropriate? Maybe show the episode and give people the reality check they need to keep them in the bloody house #casualty." Finally, one Casualty viewer concluded: "Hope they put the missing episode on iPlayer. "I get they didn't want to show it and the white suits on the preview suggest a virus situation but I still wanna watch it! We've missed a massive Marty storyline! #Casualty " Regardless of whether the BBC do eventually make the episode available to fans, Casualty will now be on a break until May 23 when it will return with its next episode. Casualty returns to BBC One later this month. What did you think of this weekend's Casualty episode? Let us know in the comments below.

Casualty fans confused as BBC skips an 'inappropriate episode'

Casualty viewers were confused last night when the BBC skipped an episode it called "inappropriate". Fans had been expecting to watch a gripping episode culminating with a showdown between Ethan and Will - but instead it was replaced by a catch-up and the following week's episode. The extended preview at the start was designed to fill in the gaps on what fans would've seen in the axed episode. A voiceover announcer said: "The episode we were due to watch tonight, filmed before the spread of COVID-19, was considered inappropriate to show at the moment. "But never fear, everything we need to know from that episode is in a catch-up right at the start of the programme." Read more: EastEnders viewers want Nancy Carter to return as Casualty confirms actress Maddy Hill's exit However glimpses of the episode from the preview showed characters dressed in full protective gear, suggesting an epidemic style storyline. Such a plot would too closely mirror real life events with the current pandemic. But that didn't stop fans being confused about what was going on. And they were still desperate to see the missing episode. One said: "Really, really disappointed at the missing episode of #Casualty, especially when it’s so pivotal to current storylines. Speaking at an Edinburgh TV Festival online Q&A, he said: "We do have to abide by the rules and while social distancing is in place it is going to be difficult. Read more: EastEnders, Casualty and Holby City are 'not quite' ready to resume production "There are ways of cheating, actors being close enough together to interact in a scene." He added: "We’re not quite at that point yet. "But all of those conversation are being had and there is a real determination to get that show back up and running." Romeo Beckham, 17, celebrates first anniversary with girlfriend despite lockdown

Romeo Beckham has celebrated his first anniversary with girlfriend Mia Regan with some cute snaps. The 17-year-old son of David and Victoria Beckham is currently separated from his girlfriend due to the coronavirus pandemic. Romeo is currently staying with his parents and younger siblings, Cruz Beckham and Harper Seven Beckham. The family celebrated patriarch David's 45th birthday on Saturday with some rather cute tributes, but now Romeo has his own milestone to mark. The lad posted a selection of throwback snaps with Mia, who is also known by Mimi Moocher. The pics came with the caption: "Happy 1 year mooch love u so much @mimimoocher." Meanwhile, Mimi posted her own tribute to her boyfriend from afar. The photo of the pair snuggling up came with the caption: "Special times more to come." Romeo has previously shared an insight into the pair's Valentine's Day trip to Paris earlier this year. The pair posed for a mirror selfie together and visited the legendary Louvre museum. Rumours of a romance between Romeo and his lady-love were seemingly confirmed when Mimi attended a private family dinner with Romeo to celebrate Victoria's Fashion Week show. Meanwhile, Romeo isn't the only Beckham kid to be loved-up. Older brother Brooklyn Beckham, 21, is currently residing in the US with his actress girlfriend, Nicola Peltz. Unlike Romeo, Brooklyn is separated from his family as he remains in lockdown with his partner. That didn't stop Brooklyn from sending dad David his own sweet birthday message on Saturday, however. Brooklyn shared a throwback photo of him with his father, writing on the Instagram post: "Happy birthday to the best dad in the world x you are my best friend and I love you. @davidbeckham." Elsewhere, Romeo's own tribute to his footballer Dad read: "Happy birthday dad I love you so so so so much and hope you have the best day. Sorry for being officially taller than you now." We're sure David is proud of all his boys - and not forgetting little Harper Seven, too! Do you have a story to sell? Rating: 2.39
Romeo Beckham celebrates first anniversary with girlfriend Mia Regan

Romeo Beckham is clearly a charmer like his father as he showered his girlfriend, Mia Regan, with all the love in celebration of their first anniversary this weekend.  The 17-year-old was feeling very sentimental as he shared cute photos of them together from the past year and it seems the honeymoon phase isn’t over just yet.  ‘Happy 1 year mooch love u so much,’ Romeo captioned the Instagram post.  Romeo’s aunt and David Beckham’s sister Joanne had all the feels over Romeo’s sweet sentiments and commented: ‘Oh my god this is the cutest ever 😍 happy one year guys ❤️.’  Although they’re celebrating their one-year anniversary now, the young lovebirds were only linked back in September 2019 when Mia was spotted with Romeo at his mum Victoria Beckham’s London Fashion Week showcase. They kept it lowkey during the runway show but were spotted sitting together during the family dinner at Harry’s Bar in Mayfair later that evening.  In November 2019, Megan then wished Romeo a happy birthday on Instagram to which he replied: ‘Happy b day Mooch. Hope you have a lovely day xxxx p.s. loving the glasses,’ making their relationship Instagram official.  Since then, it’s been a whirlwind romance for Megan and Romeo, who whisked the model off to Paris – the city of love – for a romantic weekend in December. They took in all the sights, including the Louvre, the Eiffel Tower and the Arc de Triomphe, while also hanging out with friends.  Mia also joined Romeo and his family as his dad David launched his new football team Inter Miami CF in March.  At the moment though, the couple appear to be separated by the coronavirus lockdown with Romeo self-isolating with his parents Victoria and David, and siblings Cruz and Harper in the UK, while older brother Brooklyn remains in the US with his girlfriend Nicola Peltz. The family enjoyed even more celebrations as retired footballer David celebrated his 45th birthday.  Romeo posted a celebratory message to his old man, which read: ‘Happy birthday dad I love you so so so so much and hope you have the best day ♥️sorry for being officially taller than you now.’  David quipped back: ‘It’s all because the ManBun.’  Got a showbiz story? BGT unseen clip sees 10-year-old wow judges with Chuck Berry's Johnny Be Good

A 10-year-old guitarist wowed the judges on Britain’s Got Talent with Chuck Berry’s classic Johnny Be Good. In an unseen clip from the ITV talent show, we meet little rock star, Joseph Sheppard who had the crowd eating out the palm of his hand. Before his audition, Simon Cowell complimented his hair while Amanda Holden commented on his ‘great style’. Donning a leather jacket and his guitar Joseph asked the audience: ‘Are you ready to rock Manchester?’ And it’s safe to say no one expected him to perform the way he did. Joseph got fantastic feedback from the judges after his audition as Simon said: ‘Let’s go to the rock expert on the panel, David.’ ‘You are so cool, such a little dude and you’re very very skilled I mean that is not easy to sing and play the guitar like that,’ David Walliams commented. ‘I think you’re going to be a huge star well done.’ Alesha Dixon added: ‘I was so impressed, your stage performance was fantastic, the way you owned it in front of all these people.’ While Amanda continued: ‘You are the complete package here, that was a brill audition.’ And of course, Simon Cowell had the last word as he said: ‘Very good Joseph that was a great audition, going forward in five years time where do you see yourself?’ Joseph simply replied: ‘Hopefully quite famous.’ Other acts that wowed the judges on Saturday night’s instalment were 96-year-old Nora and a group of dancing turtles. And not forgetting Amanda Holden’s golden buzzer act, which was Honey and Sammy, a mother a daughter act from Essex. Britain’s Got Talent returns on Saturday at 8pm on ITV. Got a story? Joe Wicks reunites with family after hospital hospital stay with hand fracture

Joe Wicks is back home with family after a hospital stay to have hand surgery. The fitness coach was admitted to Kingston hospital in London after falling off his bike. He has now been sent home to recuperate, and shared the moment he was reunited with his children on social media. The 33-year-old was met at the front door by Indie, who then took a selfie of her dad. In a sweet Instagram video, Joe walked into his kitchen where his one-year-old daughter Indie and baby son Marley, born in December, were sitting on the kitchen table. As he watched them playing, he told them how much he had missed them while he was in hospital. After cooking up a wholesome frittata for his family, he then settled down for a nap with baby Marley, calling it ‘heaven’. After having surgery on his hand, the father-of-two said he was feeling ‘fantastic’. In an update from his hospital bed, Joe said: ‘The antibiotics have well and truly kicked in. The inflammation and the swelling has gone right down.’ He shared that he will be resuming his popular P.E. lessons for the nation on Monday morning. Joe’s wife Rosie will be helping him out in the upcoming session as he might not be able to demonstrate certain excercises due to his injury, but he ‘doesn’t want to let anyone down’. ‘It’s well out of her comfort zone but she’s my best friend and she knows how much this means to me,’ he went on. ‘I don’t want to let anyone down but I don’t think I’m going to be able to demo many exercises so I’ll be having Rosie on camera with me. ‘I’ll still lead the session and coach you through it. I’ll just have Rosie demonstrating the moves.’ Got a story? Rating: 2.18
Joe Wicks is all smiles as he returns home from hand surgery and plays in the garden with his kids

JOE Wicks has returned home to his family following his recent hand surgery. The Body Coach - who underwent surgery for a persistent injury on his hand - was all smiles as he played with his young children at his home in Richmond today. Taking to Instagram, Joe, 33, revealed he had returned home from the hospital to be greeted by one-year-old daughter India. Alongside a snap of the adorable tot and son Marley in the kitchen, he wrote: "So happy to be home with my family." Joe and little India were later spotted playing on a climbing frame in the garden. The fitness guru - famous for giving the nation daily PE lessons on YouTube - underwent surgery this week. Sharing a snap from his hospital bed, he explained: "They aren't able to do the operation today, they have other patients in the queue. "They are a bit slower with certain things so I'm staying tonight. "They're going to give me some nice morphine, and some antibiotics on the drip-a-roo. In the morning, hopefully first thing, I'll be having the wires taken out." He added later: "I tell you what, this infection is no joke. I've had codeine up to my eyeballs. They gave me liquid morphine, but it ain't taking the edge off it. It's throbbing." He added: "I've got a drip of liquid paracetamol. That is absolutely fantastic. Paracetamol IV saves the day for now, almost instant effect and on the pain. "So glad I'm staying here tonight. I woke up all night last night as it was throbbing and pulsating like liquid hot magma. "Thanks for all your well wishes. Gonna get a good night's sleep I think." Following the procedure, the fitness star shared a short video on Instagram from his hospital bed and said it looked like they'd "left a golf ball" under his bandage.

Michael Jackson abuse accusers to try and sue firms linked to the late star

3 May 08:09 • 2 articles
Weight: 1.09
Importance: 1.48
Age penalty: 0.74
Best date: 3 May 08:09
Average US: 16.25
Weighted average US: 18.016429974370464
Average GB: 7.75
Weighted average GB: 12.553449930305645
Average IN: 6.75
Weighted average IN: 7.276829992356102

Michael Jackson abuse accusers to try and sue firms linked to the late star

Two men who accused Michael Jackson of sex abuse are expected to return to court next month to take action against firms linked to the late star. Wade Robson, 37 and James Safechuck, 42 - who appeared in the documentary Leaving Neverland last year - are reportedly going to sue MJJ Productions and MJJ Ventures. Both Wade and James claim they were molested as children by the late popstar. According to The Sun, the men want to prove the allegations were true and reveal that firm bosses were aware, or should have been. Michael Jackson's estate is still exempt from facing legal proceedings. “We’re finally back in the courtroom," their attorney Vince Finaldi is reported by the publication to have said. “We were supposed to have a hearing a couple of weeks ago, but it has been delayed due to the coronavirus – so we have another date set for June. “It will be the first hearing in the case. It’s a new judge and it will be resolved one way or another. We are preparing for a trial later in the year.” Both Wade and James previously attempted to sue the companies in 2013 and 2014. However, their case was thrown out in 2017 after a trial judge said they had waited too long to file the allegations. At the time Californian law required claimants to file before they turned 26 - but Wade and James were both in their thirties. This changed at the beginning of 2020, when a new law came into effect that allowed victims of sexual abuse to sue until they are 40 years old. Both Safechuck and Robson detailed a string of abuse claims in the 2019 documentary Leaving Neverland. Michael Jackson's estate and his family have continued to deny the sex abuse claims. Do you have a story to sell ? Get in touch with us at webcelebs@trinitymirror.com or call us direct 0207 29 3303

3 May 08:09 • mirror • https://www.mirror.co.uk/3am/celebrity-news/michael-jackson-abuse-accusers-21965677

'American Idol': Top 11 Revealed

3 May 19:15 • 2 articles
Weight: 1.04
Importance: 1.04
Age penalty: 1.00
Best date: 3 May 19:15
Average US: 58.65
Weighted average US: 56.669234847348626
Average GB: 0.35
Weighted average GB: 0.6116104918596156
Average IN: 7.15
Weighted average IN: 7.860085620761814

'American Idol': Top 11 Revealed

Following last week’s top 20 performances filmed in the contestants’ homes, the pool was chopped in half on Sunday night. The top 10 voted through by viewers had to sing virtual, at-home performances again, and judges Katy Perry, Luke Bryan and Lionel Richie provided remote feedback. The judges also opted to use their one save of the season to form a top 11. Former Idol Phillip Phillips opened the show with his very fitting song “Home,” and then the first results were announced. Louis Knight was voted through, and for his next at-home performance, he sang “In My Place” by Coldplay, accompanying himself on the keyboard while his family watched. He brought the emotion, but it wasn’t the most vocally impressive. “It pulled at my heartstrings,” Perry said. Bryan said he wasn’t completely blown away. Also voted through was Julia Gargano, who gave a gritty performance of “In Her New York State Of Mind” by Billy Joel, showing off her tone and ad libs. It was a good song choice, and Bryan went so far as to call it his favorite performance of the year so far, giving it a 12 out of 10. Richie said she made it her song. Jovin Webb delivered another smooth and captivating performance, singing “Voodoo” with an impressive delivery. “It’s magic,” Richie said. Perry said she felt transported by the performance. “You did not hit one bad note,” Bryan added. Grace Leer also advanced, singing “Over the Rainbow” in an understated and technically impressive performance. She put some of her country twang into it, and Perry said she had never heard her voice like that before. “It was like you were singing to thousands.” Jonny West sang “Faithfully” by Journey while playing the keyboard for his performance, and he put a lot of soul into it. Bryan praised his ability to make it seem effortless and commended his “well placed falsetto moments.” Also voted through, Sophia James sang an understated and intimate arrangement of “In My Room” by the Beach Boys. She also played the keyboard. “You’ve done the work in terms of sussing out where your delivery sweet spot is,” Richie said. “It was so upper-echelon,” Perry added. Arthur Gunn joined the advancing artists, giving a performance of “Country Road” by John Denver while playing the guitar. He made it his own with his signature tone and sound. “I felt so much more connected to that performance,” Perry said. “That was amazing.” He definitely put his own spin on the popular country hit. Singing “Grandma’s Hands” by Bill Withers and dedicating it to her own grandmother, Just Sam made it through. It was another really strong song choice, and Just Sam has completely come into her own. Perry again felt transported, and Bryan praised her range. Also voted through was Dillon James, who sang an up-tempo arrangement of “Yesterday” by The Beatles and played the guitar. He had a lot of runs and ad libs. “You have an absolute sound to your voice,” Richie said. Perry wanted more breath to it, and Bryan agreed. The last artist to get voted through was Francisco Martin, who sang “Falling Like The Stars” by James Arthur and played the guitar. It was an emotional and tight performance. “You really know how to get a lot of emotion out of the song,” Bryan said. Richie gave a shout out to Martin’s song, who is a first responder. The judges then opted to use their one save of the season on Makayla Phillips, who sang “The House That Built Me” by Miranda Lambert after securing her spot in the top 11. She got emotional about being able to advance. “I’m so glad you came back to allow America hear how great of a singer you are,” Bryan said of the 17-year-old singer. Lauren Spencer-Smith, Franklin Boone, DeWayne Crocker, Cyniah Elise, Kimmy Gabriela, Aliana Jester, Faith Becnel, Nick Merico and Olivia Ximines were eliminated from the competition. The top 7 will be revealed and sing against next week.

3 May 19:15 • The Hollywood Reporter • https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/american-idol-recap-top-11-revealed-1293036
Rating: 2.08
Magic Johnson Has Message For Lakers Fans Ahead Of ‘The Last Dance’

ESPN’s “The Last Dance” continues tonight with two more episodes, the first of which will be dedicated to Kobe Bryant. It has been over three months since Bryant, his daughter Gianna and seven others died in a tragic helicopter accident in California. The basketball world will never be the same, and many fans are still grieving over the loss of one of the game’s all-time greats. Episode 5 of the last dance, which airs tonight, touches on the relationship between Bryant and Michael Jordan. It has been well-documented how Kobe emulated MJ and wanted to follow in his footsteps. Tonight’s episode will recount some of their interactions over the years, including when their careers overlapped. Lakers legend and former team executive Magic Johnson thinks the footage could have a healing effect on those still mourning Kobe. He told the Los Angeles Times‘ Arash Markazi that the episode will have a profound impact. “It’s going to mean a lot to a lot of people, especially [in Los Angeles], and it’s going to mean a lot to Kobe fans,” Johnson said. “They’re going to need this. Nobody is past what happened. It will mean something to them and all of us who are Kobe fans and Lakers fans.” Considering the sudden and senseless nature of Bryant’s passing, tonight will be an emotional one for anybody tuning in. Perhaps it can also be therapeutic though. Episode 5 of “The Last Dance” debuts at 9 p.m. ET tonight on ESPN. Episode 6 will begin afterwards at 10 p.m. ET.

3 May 18:54 • The Spun • https://thespun.com/nba/los-angeles-lakers/magic-johnson-message-lakers-fans-kobe-mj-the-last-dance
Rating: 0.30

PUBG Mobile: Maxtern on how to make Tik Tok videos viral

3 May 13:06 • 2 articles

Age penalty: 1.00

Weighted average US: 9.332891751430248
Average GB: 0.4
Weighted average GB: 0.697786299172355
Average IN: 28.1
Weighted average IN: 49.01948751685794

PUBG Mobile: Maxtern on how to make Tik Tok videos viral

Maxtern is one of the most popular PUBG Mobile YouTube casters in the country and he has charted an unparalleled upward trajectory over the past few years. With over 720K subscribers on YouTube, 200K+ followers on Instagram and more than 320K followers on Tik Tok, the 22-year-old has been providing inspiration and entertainment in equal measure. Apart from being a caster, Maxtern also loves entertaining his fan base on Tik Tok, an app that has become incredibly popular recently. He likes engaging with his audience by posting videos under the entertainment section and garners thousands of views on each of his videos. Thus, I, Maxtern would want to divulge a few of my trade secrets and let the world know how you can make your videos viral and attract countless viewers. Tik Tok is one of the best social media platforms if we use it properly. It is best for short videos and can help in making users extremely popular. However, for that to happen, the content needs to be of an immensely high quality. Most people think that Tik Tok only promotes lip sync artists or dancers such as Beauty Khan but that is not the case. The platform promotes videos that have good audience retention. There are 2 types of content on Tik Tok. 1. Videos that are less than 15 seconds. 2: Videos that are longer than 15-60 seconds. The first type is one of the ways to make your video viral easily. On the other hand, videos longer than 15 sec can go viral only if average watch time is above 90%, which is hard to get in case of longer videos. Hence, most top Tik Tok users prefer to make short videos. It depends on various factors like the topic, the quality of the content, or the extent to which the content can keep a viewer glued to the video. Step 1:Choose your category: If you just started using Tik Tok and decide to do lip sync to rival Riyaz Ali, who has 36M+ followers, then your efforts might not be very useful. Lip sync has too much competition for a new user to establish a viewer base through the same. You should choose your own passion just like I have chosen PUBG. I built a base audience by putting videos on PUBG. Now, if I do good lip sync, my video will be watched because I have already built an image. Once you get a base audience, try to make videos according to your audience. For example, if you have built your audience by uploading tech videos, then suddenly uploading history lectures will not get you views. Step 2:Focus on the trend: Irrespective of the quality of your content, your videos will get viral if they follow the things that are trending currently. Step 3:Create a professional account: If you create a professional account on Tik Tok, you can view stats and other valuable data which will help you in increasing your viewer base and in making your videos viral. . Step 4:Upload time: Most people say that upload time matters on Tik Tok but I believe that quality matters more than the upload time. For example, if I upload a video at 2am, I might get only 1000 views till 6am. However, if those viewers watch the video for a considerable duration, it will start reflecting on the pages of the viewers who come online at a later stage. Step 5:Get your own hashtag: Try to create your unique hashtag e.g #YourName Many people use hashtags like #DettolHandwashChallenge in their gaming videos. 1-3 hashtags are enough to make a video viral. For example, if your video is related to PUBG Mobile and your name is Maxtern then use only #maxtern, #pubgmobile, #pubgmobileindia etc. Published 03 May 2020, 18:36 IST

3 May 13:06 • sportskeeda • https://www.sportskeeda.com/esports/maxtern-on-how-to-make-tik-tok-videos-viral?utm_source=feed&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=sportskeeda
Rating: 2.05
I love Wizkid but not his fans - Davido reacts to troll

- Top Nigerian singer, Davido, has obviously had it with being compared to Wizkid - The singer recently announced his collaboration with international star, Nicki Minaj and a Wizkid fan tried to downplay the good news - Davido then responded to the troll that he loves Wizkid but not his fans The Nigerian music industry is undoubtedly a tough and competitive one with artistes always working very hard to maintain relevance seeing as tides can easily turn and they are relegated to the background. Currently, Davido is one of the top musicians in the country but this does not mean he does not experience his own fair share of hate from trolls, especially from fans of his colleague, Wizkid, who like to compare their every achievement. Just recently, Davido took to social media via his Twitter page to share the good news of his collaboration with international rapper, Nicki Minaj. I can't name 99% of the singers in the country - Brymo throws shade A Wizkid fan then saw the news as an opportunity to hate by comparing Davido’s success to Wizkid. According to the troll, if Nicki Minaj was working with Wizkid, she would have been the one tweeting about the news and not the other way round. The troll then added that Davido should calm down because there are levels to this. Davido was obviously not impressed with the constant trolling from Wizkid’s fans who are also known as Wizkid FC. The singer expressed as much in his reply to the troll. According to the Risky crooner, he has great love for Wizkid but not for his fans. See his tweet below: Interesting. In 2019, Davido featured top American singer, Chris Brown, in his song, Blow My Mind. Without wasting much time, the energetic singer followed up his single with the release of the music video for the project, which featured him and his foreign counterpart treating fans to a great blend of pop culture. Amitabh Bachchan's Kaun Banega Crorepati 12 To Go Completely Digital In Selection, Screening Process

4 May 06:02 • 2 articles
Weight: 1.02

Age penalty: 1.00
Best date: 3 May 15:18
Average US: 1.3
Weighted average US: 2.2672201735530773
Average GB: 0.0
Weighted average GB: 0.0
Average IN: 44.9
Weighted average IN: 78.30629676348704

Amitabh Bachchan's Kaun Banega Crorepati 12 To Go Completely Digital In Selection, Screening Process

The twelfth season of the popular game show Kaun Banega Crorepati, hosted by megastar Amitabh Bachchan, is all set to make its selection process completely digital amid the coronavirus pandemic. For the season's registration promo, Bachchan shot the video from his home, remotely directed by Dangal helmer Nitesh Tiwari. Sony Entertainment Television announced that registrations will commence for the latest season from May 9 till May 22, where Bachchan will ask one new question every night on Sony TV, which can be answered either through SMS or through Sony LIV. "For the first time in the history of KBC, the entire screening and selection will be managed digitally... This is the season of firsts and we are confident that this season will redefine the power of knowledge," Amit Raisinghani, Head - Business Planning and Communication, Sony Entertainment Television said in a statement. The second step would be screening, where participants who have answered the registration questions correctly and have been shortlisted by the randomizer based on certain pre-defined reservation criteria, will be reached out to, telephonically, for further assessment. The third step will be an online audition on a general knowledge test aided by video submission. The final round will be a personal interview with the shortlisted candidates, which will be conducted remotely via video call. The entire selection process will be verified by an independent audit firm. The show will be produced by StudioNEXT and the selection process will be conducted digitally, through SonyLIV. ALSO READ: Anurag Kashyap Requests The Release Of Amitabh Bachchan’s Film 'Shoebite’

4 May 06:02 • https://www.filmibeat.com • https://www.filmibeat.com/television/news/2020/amitabh-bachchans-kaun-banega-crorepati-to-go-completely-digital-in-selection-screening-process-298403.html
Rating: 0.30
'Kaun Banega Crorepati' to go completely digital in selection, screening process

MUMBAI: The twelfth season of the popular game show "Kaun Banega Crorepati", hosted by megastar Amitabh Bachchan, is all set to make its selection process completely digital amid the coronavirus pandemic. For the season's registration promo, Bachchan shot the video from his home, remotely directed by "Dangal" helmer Nitesh Tiwari. Sony Entertainment Television announced that registrations will commence for the latest season from May 9 till May 22, where Bachchan will ask one new question every night on Sony TV, which can be answered either through SMS or through Sony LIV. "For the first time in the history of KBC, the entire screening and selection will be managed digitally...This is the season of firsts and we are confident that this season will redefine the power of knowledge," Amit Raisinghani, Head - Business Planning and Communication, Sony Entertainment Television said in a statement. The second step would be screening, where participants who have answered the registration questions correctly and have been shortlisted by the randomiser based on certain pre-defined reservation criteria, will be reached out to, telephonically, for further assessment. The third step will be online audition on general knowledge test aided by a video submission. The final round will be personal interview with the shortlisted candidates, which will be conducted remotely via video call. The entire selection process will be verified by an independent audit firm. The show will be produced by StudioNEXT and the selection process will be conducted digitally, through SonyLIV.

Peter Weber Said He "Finally Got It Right" After Going IG Official With Kelley Flanagan

Following a romantic roller coaster on his season of The Bachelor, Peter Weber says he "finally got it right" with Kelley Flanagan, as per Entertainment Tonight. Kelley, who first appeared on Peter's season of The Bachelor, but was eliminated before hometown dates, was first rumored to be dating the former star after the two were spotted together in Chicago. In April, Peter addressed the dating rumors during an episode of Nick Viall's podcast Viall Files, conceding the two were seeing each other but were, "taking it really, really slow." On Saturday, Peter confirmed his relationship with Kelley on Instagram, sharing a photo of the two kissing in an airplane. He wrote: "You caught me. Let the adventure begin." Meanwhile, Kelley made the relationship Instagram official as well, posting a throwback photo of a lanyard she'd convinced the Swedish DJ Kygo to sign, reading, "Pilot Pete — don't be dumb, pick Kelley!" In the caption Kelley wrote, "Throwback to when I met Kygo in August and got him to sign this lanyard to gift to Peter on the show!" Peter and Kelley's romance might be a bit of a surprise to fans of the ABC reality show. During the two-part finale, Peter proposed to Hannah Ann Sluss, only to break off the engagement weeks later. Instead, he rekindled his relationship with runner-up Madison Prewett, much to the disapproval of his mom. The two parted ways days after the final episode aired. Meanwhile, Kelley placed fifth on the show, but the two reportedly reconnected on a serendipitous night out post-Bachelor, according to ET. In April, Kelley shared her perspective on why they didn't connect as deeply on The Bachelor. During an interview with the Almost Famous podcast, Kelley hypothesized Bachelor producers weren't thrilled she had a chance encounter with Peter ahead of filming, and that the showrunners sabotaged the relationship, as per Vulture. "I saw him, things were getting in his head that he wasn’t able to make his own decision, and it just kind of p*ssed me off," Kelley told the hosts. She added that the show's producers reportedly encouraged Peter to eliminate her, especially considering the attorney was less willing to go along with reality-television shenanigans. In April, Chris Harrison confessed the show wasn't an ideal format for the couple's relationship to flourish. "I'll take a little blame for this, the show wasn't perfect for that relationship. I don't think Kelley was right for the show," Harrison said to ET. He added that Kelley "fought the concept" and that it "was tough for her to not be in her own head." Kelley and Peter might not have had onscreen chemistry, but it turns out the two make a good match away from the cameras.

3 May 20:23 • Bustle • https://www.bustle.com/p/peter-weber-kelley-flanagans-relationship-is-now-instagram-official-22868142
Rating: 1.99
The Bachelor’s Peter Weber and Kelley Flanagan Are Dating Because Relationships Mean Nothing

Sure, why not. Weeks after the duo was spotted on a very cozy date and definitely not quarantining in Chicago, The Bachelor’s Peter Weber and Kelley Flanagan have officially confirmed that they’re dating. Weber posted on Instagram over the weekend to share the news, saying that Flanagan “caught me” and he can’t wait to “let the adventure begin.” Following the finale of his Bachelor season two months ago, Weber and his indecisive behavior have rotated through three women: He was engaged to Hannah Ann Sluss for a few weeks, before dumping her to pursue a relationship with runner-up contestant Madison Prewett. (A decision that was met with furious disapproval from his mom.) However, days later Weber and Prewett announced their “mutual decision” to break-up, which initiated Weber’s interest in rekindling things with Flanagan, who was eliminated this season prior to the hometown episodes. Flanagan has been unusually candid of late about how little she enjoyed filming her Bachelor season, saying that the show’s producers fed her “bullshit” about Weber’s feelings. She now believes this was due to how, by complete coincidence, she ran into Weber at a hotel lobby days before filming began, giving the duo a rare pre-season connection. “I told Peter, ‘They don’t let me see you. They locked me up in a closet for three hours last week, and they won’t let me see you,’” she told the Almost Famous podcast. “I said, ‘You clearly know they push some people forward and they don’t push others forward.’ It’s just — I saw him, things were getting in his head that he wasn’t able to make his own decision, and it just kind of pissed me off.” Flanagan added that the producers were constantly “in his head” and encouraged Weber to eliminate her as the season progressed, given that she wasn’t as made-for-reality-TV friendly as other contestants. (Flanagan is an attorney who did not act like a messy bitch who lived for the drama.) Here’s hoping the third time is actually the charm, but if not, whatever.

Quiet prayer service held for Rishi Kapoor

A small prayer meet was held today at the Bandra residence of actor Rishi Kapoor, who passed away on April 30 after two years of battling Leukaemia. Given the lockdown and corona situation, the family ensured that only a few close family members attended the prayer meet. Randhir Kapoor said, “Rasam pagri puja was held yesterday. His ashes were immersed today in Banganga, Mumbai, followed by a quiet prayer service with family at his home because of the virus.” Along with wife Neetu and son Ranbir, the late actor’s daughter, Riddhima,was also present for the prayer meet. Riddhima, who couldn’t attend her father’s final rites owing to travel restrictions, reached Mumbai on Saturday evening after taking special permission to travel from Delhi by road.

She was not sanctioned permission to fly down on the same day for the funeral. She reached Mumbai by road for the prayer meet held in memory of her late father and actor Rishi Kapoor. Katie Price reveals she needs therapy for life after ‘slowly going off the rails for 10 years’

KATIE Price claims she needs therapy for life as she comes to terms with 'going off the reals' in a clip from her new TV show. The 41-year-old doesn't hold back in the hour-long special of My Crazy Life, telling viewers she's been to "hell and back". In a teaser clip, she says: "I've been slowly going off the rails for just over 10 years. "At times I've been a mess. I've been to hell and back, but I'm starting to feel like me again. "Four weeks in hospital and some intense therapy that will continue for the rest of my life has got me back to being me. "It just goes to show, if I can do it, anyone can!" Katie recently revealed to The Sun Online how she burst into tears after being reunited with children Princess and Junior after six weeks apart. The mum-of-five has suffered a tough time being separated from her kids in lockdown amid the coronavirus crisis. The family were forced apart after Junior, 14, showed signs of the deadly bug while staying with his dad Peter Andre. This week she was finally able to see him and 12-year-old Princess again. Katie told us: “I can't believe how much the kids have grown in six weeks - Pete's had them sleeping in grow bags! "I welled up, it’s been a tough six weeks not being able to hug them. "After five minutes together it was back to the usual fun and craziness." Meanwhile Katie has been staying with pals at a posh pad in Surrey - just ten minutes away from Peter - as she isolates with her eldest son Harvey. She has been shielding the disabled 17-year-old from danger because he is at high-risk from coronavirus because of his health condition. Her youngest kids Jett and Bunny have been living with their dad Kieran Hayler and his fiancee Michelle Penticost. Junior and Princess have spent the last six weeks with Peter and his wife Emily - who is an A&E doctor battling coronavirus on the frontline. It has meant Katie's kids haven't been able to all be together since lockdown began. "It’s been hardest on Harvey because he really misses the contact with his siblings," Katie added. "Fingers crossed we’ll be a complete unit with Jett and Bunny joining us this weekend. "My children are my perfect pieces of heaven - they have kept me strong through thick and thin. "Unconditional love is free and means everything to me.” The 41-year-old reality star posted a cute video last night of Harvey, Princess and Junior clapping the NHS on their doorstep. "It’s Thursday, so let’s show our appreciation and respect for all the incredible key workers keeping our country going", she told fans. We pay for videos too. Click here to upload yours.

I For India: Tiger Shroff Sings A Varun Dhawan Song, Arjun Kapoor Proves He Is A Marvel Fan While Kartik Aaryan Throws A Surprise

I For India: A historical event like I for India has been organized by Give India, which will see 85 top celebrities from both Bollywood and Hollywood come together for a virtual concert and raise funds for the frontline workers who have been protecting us from the Coronavirus pandemic. Right in the beginning, the event saw Tiger Shroff surprising fans by crooning a Varun Dhawan song. While we have seen him carry off some daredevil stunts in the past, this was definitely a first for all his fans. Putting on his sunglasses as he is shy, Tiger Shroff sang Theher Ja from the Varun Dhawan starrer October. He also sang one of his favourite songs, Roop Tera Mastana, from Aaradhna. Later when Arjun Kapoor came on the screen to encourage the audience to donate for the fund, we noticed Groot’s action figure kept as a showpiece on his shelf, making us wonder if the Panipat actor is also a big Marvel fan, just like us. Arjun requested people to donate generously for those who are struggling for shelter and food. Kartik Aaryan also took everyone by surprise as he didn’t use any monologue this time. He simply requested fans to donate for those affected by the lockdown by stating that this time he is not here to deliver long monologues, but instead wants people to donate with large hearts. Until now many actors in the concert have made an appeal to stand united in these tough times. The four-hour-long concert live on Facebook will feature performances and personal messages from over 85 Indian and global stars including Aamir Khan, Shah Rukh Khan, Abhishek Bachchan, Priyanka Chopra Jonas, Hrithik Roshan, Kareena Kapoor Khan, Vidya Balan, Shabana Azmi, Aishwarya Rai Bachchan, Alia Bhatt, Arjun Kapoor, Saif Ali Khan, Rani Mukherji, Madhuri Dixit Nene, Akshay Kumar, Diljit Dosanjh, Dulquer Salmaan, Katrina Kaif, Vicky Kaushal, Anushka Sharma, Ayushmann Khurrana, Tiger Shroff, Sophie Turner, AR Rahman, Bryan Adams, Mindy Kaling, Gulzar, Javed Akhtar, Jay Sean, Ustad Amjad Ali Khan, Jonas Brothers, Amaan Ali, Ayaan Ali, Shankar Ehsaan Loy, Sonu Nigam, Anoushka Shankar, Arijit Singh, Badshah, Rekha Bharadwaj and others. Directors such as Farhan Akhtar, Farah Khan, Karan Johar, Kiran Rao, Zoya Akhtar will also be there.

It looked to be a great minds think alike kind of deal, fashion wise, for the youngsters as they twinned in their adorable matching outfits! Both of the girls wore white tank tops and colorful sweatpants that were different variations of the color pink. Kim Kardashian & Kanye West‘s eldest child also sported a pink sweatshirt tied around her waist with her hair up in a bun. The girls did differ in the shoe department, however, as North opted to wear pink sandals while Penelope had on orange sneakers. Vroom vroom! North and Penelope looked to be spending part of their day getting in some exercise as the latter was seen chilling with her bike outside. Her father Scott Disick, 35, has been enjoying a much different kind of vehicle as of late as he’s been seen on the beaches of Malibu on his motorbike with girlfriend Sofia Richie, 22. The longtime couple have been escaping quarantine over the past month with Sofia stunning in a variety of gorgeous bikinis that effortlessly highlight her amazing figure. Penelope and North’s reunion happened just weeks after the KarJenner clan put on one epic birthday bash for Kourtney amid them being in self-isolation. Cindy Kimberly Lounges In Bed Rocking A Savage x Fenty Look

May 3, 2020 Ava Bennet Brunette bombshell Cindy Kimberly recently shared a sizzling triple Instagram update with her 6.3 million Instagram followers in which she showcased her buxom body in a Savage x Fenty ensemble. In the caption of the post, Cindy explained that she was an ambassador for the brand, and she showed off a pink set in the sexy snaps. Cindy was stretched out on a bed with white linens, and a few silver pillows scattered around her. She had a magazine open on the bed in the first snap, but her attention was on the camera rather than the reading material in front of her. Cindy rocked a bright pink bra that showcased a tantalizing amount of cleavage, and a hint of matching pink bottoms were visible. Her long brunette locks tumbled down her chest and shoulder in an effortless bedhead style, and her bronzed skin looked incredible. Cindy parted her lips seductively in the shot, and had a soft pink hue on her plump pout. Bold brows framed her brown eyes, and she had a sexy smoky eye done in shades of bronze and brown for a more subtle look. Cindy also had a heavy dose of blush and highlighter, giving her a gorgeous glow. The second shot was taken from a different perspective, and showed Cindy laying down on the bed with fluffy white linens surrounding her. She paired the bralette top with some skimpy shorts that barely covered anything at all. Her brunette locks were spread out around her, and her curvaceous physique looked incredible in the skimpy set. For the third and final snap, Cindy returned to her sprawled out position and rested her curvaceous hips and thighs on one of the silver pillows while her hands were on another pillow. She posed in a way that accentuated her hourglass physique and showcased the bright pink Savage x Fenty pieces. Her followers couldn’t get enough of the triple update, and the post racked up over 617,400 likes within just 20 hours. It also received 2,058 comments from her eager fans. “GIRL OMG,” one fan exclaimed, unable to handle Cindy’s beauty in the shots. “This girl is something else,” another fan said. “Thanks for actually having a real body and being even more beautiful bc of that,” one follower commented, loving Cindy’s curvaceous physique. “Ma’am you’re too hot,” another cheekily said. Whether she’s rocking lingerie or swimwear, Cindy loves to showcase her tantalizing curves. Just a few days ago, as The Inquisitr reported, Cindy shared a double update taken somewhere outdoors with a row of greenery and flowers visible behind her. She wore a skimpy and feminine white bikini top that dipped low, showing off plenty of cleavage, and accessories with a two gold necklaces and a pair of small hoop earrings.

In the Herald: May 4, 1985

Star Wars threat: study The Star Wars military program had the potential to “tear the Western Alliance apart”, the Australian-born director of the International Institute for Strategic Studies, Dr Robert O’Neil, said. Star Wars, officially called the Strategic Defence Initiative, had reopened the old arguments of the late '60s about the desirability of anti-ballistic missile systems. Dr O’Neil was launching the institute’s 1984-85 Strategic Survey. No sale of the century “A champion contestant on the television quiz show Sale of the Century has been forced to return all her prizes after the producers discovered she had appeared on the program before,” wrote entertainment reporter Richard Glover. “She did well during her first appearances on the show 2½ years ago. During her second try, recorded over the past few weeks, the woman did even better, winning eight episodes.” Rector quits over wine “An Anglican rector is to quit his parish in a dispute concerning the use of non-alcoholic grape juice in Holy Communion. The Rev Lance Keogh, rector of St Barnabas’s, Oberon, is at loggerheads with the Bishop of Bathurst, the Rt Rev Howell Witt, who adopts the traditional line that fermented or alcoholic wine should be used. It was hinted that the rector was concerned with the situation of recovered alcoholics.”

Rating: 0.86
In the Herald: May 4, 1985

The Star Wars military program had the potential to “tear the Western Alliance apart”, the Australian-born director of the International Institute for Strategic Studies, Dr Robert O’Neil, said. Star Wars, officially called the Strategic Defence Initiative, had reopened the old arguments of the late '60s about the desirability of anti-ballistic missile systems. Dr O’Neil was launching the institute’s 1984-85 Strategic Survey. “A champion contestant on the television quiz show Sale of the Century has been forced to return all her prizes after the producers discovered she had appeared on the program before,” wrote entertainment reporter Richard Glover. “She did well during her first appearances on the show 2½ years ago. During her second try, recorded over the past few weeks, the woman did even better, winning eight episodes.” “An Anglican rector is to quit his parish in a dispute concerning the use of non-alcoholic grape juice in Holy Communion. The Rev Lance Keogh, rector of St Barnabas’s, Oberon, is at loggerheads with the Bishop of Bathurst, the Rt Rev Howell Witt, who adopts the traditional line that fermented or alcoholic wine should be used. It was hinted that the rector was concerned with the situation of recovered alcoholics.”
